bbsBuildArtifacts: comparing BBS states over time

Vincent J. Carey, stvjc at channing.harvard.edu

September 08, 2022

Source: vignettes/comparison.Rmd
comparison.Rmd

Identifying packages with new events relative to a prior build

We have created “trimmed tarballs” from two dates: Dec 10 2021 and Jan 5 2022 and included these with the package.

Here’s the more recent one.

 suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(bbsBuildArtifacts)
 })
 af2 = make_demo_ArtifSet(url = demo_url2(),
        demostring = "test_report_3.14_bioc_20220105", destbase = "test_report_0105")
 af2

The default demonstration ArtifSet is from Dec 10 2021.

 af1 = make_demo_ArtifSet()
 af1

The new_events function will enumerate packages exhibiting new events. Arguments to the function specify the build phase and event type to be sought.

 new_events(af1, af2)

This report is host-dependent; the default here was nebbiolo2.

 new_events(af1, af2, host="tokay2")

Packages for which events have resolved 

 becomes_OK(af1, af2)
 becomes_OK(af1, af2, host="tokay2")

Comprehensive comparison 

hn = slot(af1, "hostnames")
lapply(hn, function(x) becomes_OK(af1, af2, host=x))

Also iterate over event types. Note that resolution of events to OK does not imply that the identified packages have been changed. The dependency graph could be used to find the causative package.

We have recently added available_artifs() to provide information on dates and versions of artifact sets in cache.
